FuncDef:
The arp-proxy inner-sub-vlan-proxy enable command enables intra-VLAN proxy Address Resolution Protocol (ARP).
The undo arp-proxy inner-sub-vlan-proxy enable command disables intra-VLAN proxy ARP.
By default, intra-VLAN proxy ARP is disabled, inter-VLAN proxy ARP is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If two hosts are within the same isolate-user-VLAN, communication between them on the Layer 2 network cannot be implemented. In this case, run the arp-proxy inner-sub-vlan-proxy enable command on the associated VLAN interface to enable intra-VLAN proxy ARP. This configuration implements communication between the hosts within an isolate-user-VLAN.
Prerequisites
Hosts that require communication are within the same VLAN, and it is an isolate-user-VLAN.
